Operation Detour is an anti-smuggling educational program established in 2009 by the U.S. Border Patrol in south Texas, to depict the horrors and tragedies that can occur when individuals and their families become involved with human or narcotics smuggling. Thank you for coming to present to our students!

Ombudsman Arizona Charter Northeast was happy to welcome Fernanda from ASU Public Allies Program to present on paid apprenticeship opportunities available for students 18 years old and over, for the upcoming year.

The students enjoyed the presentation, and several expressed interest in moving forward with the program after the visit. Thanks to all who helped make this possible for our students!

Learn more about the ASU Public Allies Program here: https://lodestar.asu.edu/content/about-public-allies-arizona

Last week, Ombudsman Chicago Northwest enjoyed fun festivities at an International Day Celebration! This month there are many reasons to celebrate other cultures: May 3 was Polish Constitution Day, May 5 was Cinco de Mayo, and May is also Asian Pacific American Heritage Month.

We love celebrating the rich and diverse cultures represented by our students and Ombudsman community!
